intro: Ormocarpum striatum, commonly known as the striped orache, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, ribbed, and often spiny stems. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture with prominent veins. Ormocarpum striatum is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
